documentType: FBI 302 (Electronic Communication and Grand Jury Subpoena Responses)
summary: This document is an FBI electronic communication opening a grand jury subfile for a death investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein, followed by FD-302 reports documenting responses to grand jury subpoenas served on 4chan, Apple, and AT&T. The 4chan response includes an anonymous post alleging suspicious circumstances around Epstein's death and a possible switch-out. The document shows the FBI gathering digital records as part of the investigation into Epstein's death. This document is a technical report from AT&T detailing definitions for network features and a log of voice usage records for a specific mobile device (IMEI 3594090814785818, Apple iPhone X) from July 6 to July 10, 2019. It appears to be a response to a law enforcement query for subscriber records, likely related to an investigation. This document is a detailed AT&T telephone call log, likely obtained via a search warrant or subpoena, covering the period from July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019. It records numerous calls between a specific device (Apple iPhone X) and a consistent terminating number, showing frequent and sometimes lengthy communication patterns in the weeks leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death. This document is a detailed AT&T phone record report, likely subpoenaed by law enforcement, covering voice and SMS activity for a specific device (IMEI 35940908147858, Apple iPhone X) from July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019. The report was run on August 15, 2019, and shows extensive call and text activity during the period just before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death. This document is a set of AT&T telecommunications records (mobility, international, and wireline call detail) produced on August 15, 2019, covering the period from July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019. The records pertain to a subscriber account linked to a person named Karyna B and show extensive international calling activity, particularly to countries like Switzerland, Belarus, Russia, and France, during the weeks leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and death. This document is a collection of financial records provided by Citibank in response to a federal grand jury subpoena from the Southern District of New York. It includes call detail records from AT&T, affidavits, and detailed bank statements and transaction histories for accounts associated with Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, showing numerous deposits, withdrawals, and purchases from late 2018 through August 2019. This document is a series of Citibank account statements for a joint checking and savings account held by Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, covering the period from December 6, 2018, to February 5, 2019. It details routine financial transactions including purchases, transfers, payroll deposits, and fees, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein or related case activities. This document is a Citibank account statement for Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, covering checking and savings activity from February 5 to March 5, 2019. It details numerous transactions including purchases, transfers, cash withdrawals, and recurring payments, primarily in the Bronx, NY area. The statement shows regular payroll deposits and transfers to a savings account. This document is a Citibank monthly statement for a checking and savings account held by Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, covering the period March 6 to April 7, 2019. It details numerous transactions including transfers, withdrawals, debit purchases, and payroll deposits, showing the account activity of the named individuals. This is a Citibank account statement for Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves for the period April 8 to May 5, 2019. It details checking and savings account activity, including numerous debit card purchases, transfers, and cash withdrawals, primarily in the Bronx, NY area. The document is a standard bank statement with no direct mention of Epstein-related activities. This document is a Citibank monthly statement for a joint account held by Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, covering the period May 6 to June 5, 2019. It details checking and savings account transactions, including transfers, purchases, cash withdrawals, and payments, primarily in the Bronx, NY area. The statement shows routine personal and household spending. This document is a Citibank account statement for a joint checking and savings account held by Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, covering the period June 6 to July 7, 2019. It details numerous debit card purchases, ATM withdrawals, transfers, and fees, showing personal spending patterns primarily in the Bronx, NY, and some travel-related expenses. This document is a Citibank account statement for a joint checking and savings account held by Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, covering the period from July 7 to August 5, 2019. It details numerous transactions including payroll deposits, transfers, purchases, cash withdrawals, and fees, primarily in the Bronx, NY area. The document appears to be part of a financial records disclosure, possibly related to an investigation into financial activities. This document is a Citibank checking and savings account statement for the period ending August 5, 2019, for account holders Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves. It details numerous transactions including purchases, cash withdrawals, transfers, and Zelle payments, primarily in the Bronx, NY area. The document appears to be a standard bank statement with no direct, explicit mention of Epstein-related activities, persons, or events. This document is a Citibank account statement and transaction report for an account holder, covering the period from January 1, 2019, to August 21, 2019. It details numerous transactions including deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and purchases, with many occurring in the Bronx, NY area. The report appears to be part of financial records related to the Epstein case investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation is regarding his death. An anonymous 4chan post details suspicious circumstances surrounding his death in custody.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed grand jury subpoenas served on AT&T as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Daniel Dixon
persons.role: Compliance Analyst / Custodian of Records for AT&T
persons.context: Signed declarations and certificates of authenticity for AT&T's responses to the grand jury subpoenas.

persons.name: Ian
persons.context: Sent Apple's response to the legal request, providing encrypted data and technical instructions.

persons.name: Karyna B
persons.context: Listed as the user/subscriber for an AT&T mobile phone number (associated with IMEI 35940908147858 and IMSI 310410662903025) with a service address in New York, NY, and a billing address in Swain, NY. The account was active during the period covered by the call records.

persons.name: Melissa Leal
persons.role: Legal Support Specialist / Custodian of Records
persons.context: Employee of Citibank who provided an affidavit certifying the attached bank records in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Roberto Grijalva
persons.context: Primary account holder on multiple Citibank accounts, with transactions showing deposits, withdrawals, and purchases. Also a signatory on accounts with Charlene Nieves.

persons.name: Charlene Nieves
persons.context: Joint account holder with Roberto Grijalva on Citibank accounts, listed as a signer on deposit slips and account statements.

persons.name: Amanda V Montemavor
persons.context: Notary who witnessed and certified Melissa Leal's affidavit on September 3, 2019.

persons.name: Francisco Mendez
persons.context: Name appears on a deposit image, potentially a recipient or source of funds.

persons.context: Received a Zelle credit payment of $100.00 to the account on December 24, 2018, as indicated in the transaction log.

persons.context: Received a $150.00 Zelle payment from the account on July 29, 2019, as indicated in the transaction log. The name appears truncated.

persons.name: Zelimitzia Medez
persons.context: Recipient of a $125 MoneySend (Zelle) payment from the account on March 5, 2019.

persons.name: Rebeca Grijalva
persons.context: Received a $50.00 Zelle payment from the account on April 17, 2019, as indicated in the transaction log.

persons.context: Recipient of multiple 'MoneySend' debit transfers from the account, with transactions sent to Sioux Falls, SD.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, authorized grand jury subpoenas as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.
Joint holders of Citibank accounts, co-signers on checks and deposit slips, indicating a shared financial relationship.

Leal, as a Citibank employee, certified and provided Grijalva's financial records to law enforcement via a grand jury subpoena.
A Zelle payment was credited to the account from Mendez, Miti on December 24, 2018.
A Zelle payment was credited to the joint account from Mendez, Miti on December 24, 2018.
Roberto Grijalva sent a $200 Zelle payment to Brianna Grij on February 26, 2019.
Roberto Grijalva sent a $125 MoneySend payment to Zelimitzia Medez on March 5, 2019.
Roberto sent a $50 Zelle payment to Rebeca, suggesting a familial or personal financial connection.
Junelly Nieves sent a $140 credit to the account, suggesting a familial or personal financial connection, likely related to Charlene Nieves.
Roberto sent a $150 MoneySend payment to Mitzia Mendez.
Roberto Grijalva's account made a Zelle payment to Brianna Gru.
Roberto Grijalva's account made a Zelle payment to Earl Marcus.
Account holder(s) made Zelle payments to Brianna Grij, suggesting a personal or familial financial connection.
Account holder initiated multiple 'MoneySend' debit transfers to Zelimitzia Mendez.
Account holder initiated a 'MoneySend' debit transfer to Denise Andmo.
Grijalva (or joint account holder) sent an $85 MoneySend payment to Zelwitzia Mendez in Sioux Falls, SD.
Both share the surname 'Nieves', suggesting a potential familial relationship.
Multiple financial transactions (P2P payments) from the account to Brianna.
Multiple financial transactions (P2P payments) from the account to Mitzia Mendez.

events.title: Anonymous 4chan Post About Epstein's Death
events.description: An anonymous post on 4chan's /pol/ board alleges suspicious events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) the night before Epstein's death, including him being taken for medical care in a wheelchair, an unlogged transport van arriving, and a man in a 'green dress military outfit' being present. The poster suggests Epstein was 'switched out'.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served on AT&T
events.description: A grand jury subpoena signed by AUSA Geoffrey S. Berman is served on AT&T, requesting records for specific telephone numbers for the period from July 6, 2019, onward.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served on AT&T for IP Addresses
events.description: A second grand jury subpoena is served on AT&T, requesting subscriber information for specific IP addresses associated with the 4chan posts from August 10, 2019.

events.title: AT&T Subpoena Response
events.description: AT&T, via Daniel Dixon, provides a partial response to the first subpoena and declares it has no records responsive to the IP address subpoena.

events.title: Apple Subpoena Response
events.description: Apple provides an encrypted response to a legal request (subpoena) for data, related to case number 2019R01059.

events.title: AT&T Voice Usage Records Query
events.description: AT&T provides a detailed log of voice call transactions for a specific mobile device (Apple iPhone X, IMEI 3594090814785818) in response to a law enforcement query. The records show numerous calls, including mobile-originating (MO), mobile-terminating (MT), and short transactions (ST), with various network features like call forwarding and voicemail.

events.title: AT&T Report Generation
events.description: AT&T runs a query and generates a report of mobility voice usage records for the period of July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019, though the detailed log provided covers only July 6-10, 2019.

events.title: Telephone Surveillance Period
events.description: AT&T provided call detail records for a specific mobile number (IMEI: 35940908147858) for this period, as requested by law enforcement.

events.title: Phone Activity Monitoring Period
events.description: AT&T phone records for a specific device (Apple iPhone X, IMEI 35940908147858) were queried and provided, showing extensive voice and SMS activity.

events.title: Record Query and Report Generation
events.description: AT&T generated this report of phone records in response to a law enforcement query.

events.title: AT&T Records Query Period
events.description: Time period for which AT&T telecommunications records (call detail, mobility data) were queried and produced, covering approximately five weeks.

events.title: AT&T Records Production
events.description: Date the AT&T records were run/produced in response to a query or legal request (likely a subpoena or warrant).

events.title: Citibank Subpoena Response
events.description: Citibank, via Melissa Leal, responds to a federal grand jury subpoena (Ref# 2019R01059) by providing bank records for accounts associated with Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves.

events.title: AT&T Records Query
events.description: AT&T provides call detail records for a period covering July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019, in response to a legal request.

events.title: Financial Privacy Act Request
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office submits a Request for Financial Information under the Right to Financial Privacy Act, authorizing payment for records from Citibank.

events.title: Account Statement Period
events.description: The period covered by the Citibank account statement, detailing all financial transactions.

events.title: Zelle Payment to Brianna Grij
events.description: A $100.00 Zelle payment is made from the account to Brianna Grij.

events.title: Large Zelle Payment and Fees
events.description: A $500.00 Zelle payment is made to Brianna Grij. The account is also charged a $25 monthly service fee and $12.50 in non-Citibank ATM fees.

events.title: Payroll Deposit
events.description: An ACH electronic credit for "CITY OF NEW YORK PAYROLL" is deposited into the account.

events.title: Large ACH Debit
events.description: An ACH electronic debit for $2,194.32 labeled "usak usak" is withdrawn from the account.

keyFacts: An anonymous 4chan post from August 10, 2019, contains a detailed, first-hand account alleging highly irregular and suspicious activity at the MCC on the night preceding Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide, including an unlogged transport van and a possible switch-out.
The FBI opened a grand jury subfile specifically for a 'death investigation' related to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the official scrutiny into the circumstances of his death.
Federal investigators issued grand jury subpoenas to major tech and telecom companies (4chan, Apple, AT&T) to obtain digital records as part of the Epstein death investigation.

One subpoena sought to identify the individual(s) behind specific IP addresses that posted the anonymous 4chan allegations about Epstein's death, showing investigators were pursuing the source of the claims.
AT&T's response indicated it could not associate the provided IP addresses with individual subscriber accounts, highlighting a potential investigative hurdle.

The document is a proprietary AT&T report containing detailed technical definitions for cellular network features (LAC, CID, ECGI, call features like call forwarding, barring) and a log of voice usage records.
The voice usage log is for a specific device: an Apple iPhone X with IMEI 3594090814785818, spanning from July 6 to July 10, 2019, showing hundreds of call transactions.
The report was generated on August 15, 2019, in response to a query for records from July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019, indicating it was likely produced for a law enforcement investigation.

The records include precise timestamps (in UTC), call durations, originating/terminating numbers (partially redacted), and network feature codes, providing a detailed communication timeline for the device in question.
No named individuals, locations, or specific case details are mentioned in this technical document chunk; it focuses entirely on network data and definitions.
The document is a law enforcement request for AT&T call records from July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019, run on August 15, 2019.
It details extensive call activity from a specific Apple iPhone X (IMEI: 35940908147858) to a consistent terminating number (310410662903025).
The call log shows frequent, sometimes lengthy calls (e.g., 31 minutes, 20 minutes) throughout July 2019, a critical period before Epstein's arrest on July 6 and his death on August 10.
The document is marked 'AT&T Proprietary' and 'for use by authorized persons only', indicating it was part of an official investigation.
No personal names are listed in this chunk; the data is limited to technical call records (numbers, IMEI, timestamps, durations).
The document is a law enforcement subpoena response from AT&T detailing phone records for a specific Apple iPhone X (IMEI 35940908147858).

The records cover a critical period from July 6, 2019, to August 11, 2019, which includes the time leading up to and immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and his death on August 10, 2019.
The report shows hundreds of voice calls and text messages (SMS), indicating significant communication activity on the monitored device during this period.
The document is marked 'AT&T Proprietary' and 'for use by authorized persons only,' confirming its status as a confidential law enforcement record.
No specific individuals are named in this data chunk; the information is purely technical, listing connection dates, times, durations, and device identifiers.
Telecommunications records were produced for a specific AT&T subscriber account on August 15, 2019, covering activity from July 6 to August 11, 2019.
The primary subscriber/user identified in the records is 'Karyna B', with a New York City address and a billing address in Swain, NY.

The records show extensive international call activity from the associated phone numbers to countries including Switzerland, Belarus, Russia, France, the United Kingdom, and Israel during this period.

The timing of the records request (produced August 15, 2019) and the covered period (July-August 2019) coincides closely with Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and his death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The document is marked 'AT&T Proprietary' and 'for use by authorized persons only', indicating it was likely produced under legal process as part of an investigation.
Citibank provided financial records for Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves in response to a federal grand jury subpoena (Ref# 2019R01059) from the SDNY.

The records show frequent, sometimes large, transactions in 2019, including a $6,860.50 deposit on August 9, 2019, and a $1,500 cash withdrawal labeled 'Retirement Plan Services Distribution' on February 16, 2019.
An AT&T call detail record log for a period in July-August 2019 is included, showing numerous calls, potentially from a subject of investigation.
A U.S. Department of Justice form shows the government paid Citibank $33.21 for the cost of searching, processing, and reproducing the requested records.
The document contains no references to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any known associates or victims from the Epstein case.

The financial activity shown is routine personal spending, including purchases at retailers like Target, Amazon, and restaurants, along with payroll deposits from 'CITY OF NEW YORK' and government benefits.
The account holders, Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, appear to be unrelated individuals based in the Bronx, New York, with no evident connection to the Epstein network.
This document appears to be part of a large data release where many unrelated financial records were included, possibly from a broad subpoena or data collection.
The document is a personal bank statement for Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, showing no direct transactional link to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or his entities.
Account activity is consistent with routine personal and household expenditures in the New York City area, including groceries, dining, retail, and utility payments.
The statement includes several transfers to a linked Citi Savings account and payments to individuals via Zelle/MoneySend.
Recurring deposits include payroll from "CITY OF NEW YORK" and "AGRI TREAS 310 FED SAL," suggesting employment with city and federal agricultural entities.
Several travel-related purchases appear, including airline tickets (American, United, Copa Airlines) and a Carnival Cruise ticket, indicating personal travel during the period.
The bank statement belongs to Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves, showing no direct connection to Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.
Account activity includes regular payroll deposits from 'CITY OF NEW YORK PAYROLL' and 'AGRI TREAS 310 FED SAL', suggesting employment with city or federal entities.
Numerous personal transactions are recorded, including purchases at retail stores, restaurants, and for services like Verizon, Netflix, and Carnival Cruise tickets.
The statement period is March 6 to April 7, 2019, which is after Epstein's 2019 arrest but shows no transactions linked to him.
The document is a standard personal bank statement with no evidentiary value to the Epstein case based on its content.
This document is a personal bank statement for Roberto Grijalva and Charlene Nieves with no apparent direct connection to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or his criminal activities.
The account activity shows routine personal expenditures at retailers, restaurants, and for utilities in the Bronx, NY area.
Several person-to-person payments (Zelle, MoneySend) were made to individuals named Rebeca Grijalva, Junelly Nieves, and Mitzia Mendez.
